summary: The Department of Defense school system collects detailed information about reported unwanted sexual behaviors—from inappropriate touching to sexual assault—among its more than 66,000 students. However, some students involved in such incidents may not be getting the support they need, such as mental health counseling. The military's Family Advocacy Program is charged with responding to these incidents, but only military dependents are eligible for most of...
title: K-12 Education: DOD Has Taken Steps to Support Students Affected by Problematic Sexual Behaviors, but Challenges Remain
